page.title: 15PRESTON VILLAGE GREEN
page.content: The green is at the centre of the village.Once,a sheep fair was held here each October but this ended at the start of the 1st World War by which time it had become a funfair. The well was the gift of William Henry Darton.It was dug in the summer of 1872 when most of the ponds_from which all water was drawn_had dried up.A feature of the green used to be 5 elm trees.These were felled in 1946 after being declared unsafe.One was planted to commemorate the coronation of George 111.At the coronation of Queen Elizabeth in 1953, an oak sapling from the Royal Oak at Hatfield was planted. Around the green are many old cottages the Red Lion pub and the post office. The whole is a conservation area and an attractive focal point for the village.
